abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, who will step down Jan. 1, has been under fire from the Securities and Exchange Commission and the attorney general of New York.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis, who will step down Jan. 1, has been under fire from the Securities and Exchange Commission and the attorney general of New York.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:19 p.m. Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, will step down effective Jan. 1, the bank said late Wednesday afternoon, capping months of turmoil and intense scrutiny over the bank’s ill-fated merger last fall with Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Lewis to Step Down as Bank of America’s Chief
